title: Sanoid.net configuration
description: Configuration schema for Sanoid.net's Sanoid.json configuration file

UseSanoidConfiguration.description: Should Sanoid.net use the standard ini-formatted configuration files?
UseSanoidConfiguration.$comment: At this time, only "true" is acceptable, as alternate configuration has not been implemented yet.

SanoidConfigurationPathBase.description: The base directory where the ini-formatted sanoid configuration files are located, without trailing slash.

SanoidConfigurationDefaultsFile.description: The name of the file containing configuration defaults for the perl version of sanoid. File must be located in the directory specified in #properties/SanoidConfigurationPathBase

SanoidConfigurationLocalFile.description: The name of the local configuration file for the perl version of sanoid. File must be located in the directory specified in #properties/SanoidConfigurationPathBase

Formatting.description: Configuration section for configurable formatting options for output, naming, etc.

SnapshotNaming.description: Formatting configuration section for composing snapshot names.

ComponentSeparator.description: The string used for separating the prefix, timestamp, and suffix components of a snapshot name.

Prefix.description: The prefix component of all snapshot names.

TimestampFormatString.description: .net-style DateTime format string for the timestamp component of snapshot names.
TimestampFormatString.$comment: Note that many characters have special meanings. See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings for details on composing this string. Passed to the DateTime.ToString() method. This string MUST be valid for use as a component of a ZFS snapshot name.

FrequentSuffix.description: The suffix component of frequent snapshot names.

HourlySuffix.description: The suffix component of hourly snapshot names.

DailySuffix.description: The suffix component of daily snapshot names.

WeeklySuffix.description: The suffix component of weekly snapshot names.

MonthlySuffix.description: The suffix component of monthly snapshot names.

YearlySuffix.description: The suffix component of yearly snapshot names.
